content: Please understand that fewer than 1% of users ever donate even a nickel, yet use Thunderbird and come here for their free support. So, it's only natural that there would be a gentle reminder on this topic. However, it is easily removed at settings>general and untick the daily start page.
creator: davidsk

content: This is not an easy task. I located this response from an earlier post that has all the information. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1126211
creator: davidsk

content:
downloading only the address books was never something officially suggested. it was a hack that worked for most folks, and usually left a load of stuff behind because most folk have more than one address book.

So you exported your profile to a ZIP and them imported it. My guess is the answer to that is no, despite your comment about how everything is there but the address book. A download from the web and a setting up of IMAP accounts will get you to this point with mail and no address book. Or addons Or calendar Or personalization settings.

I suggest you create the zip and try importing it. Or the SQLITe database that forms the address book in that ZIP.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You do not have a Thunderbird account. No one except a few employees of Mzla do.

If you are receiving an error message when sending mail, perhaps post the details of that message (verbatim please) so someone might be able to form some sort of idea what the issue is.

content:
See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-export

You will find import from an address book offers to import from a backed up profile.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I cannot give much help here, but there are possibilities. If this is a POP account, the excessive downloads may happen if the popstat.dat file in the profile is corrupted. That is the file that keeps track of which messages have already been downloaded. Another possibility is if you are using the AllMail folder, which contains all messages and is a duplicate of messages in other folders. Otherwise, I have not seen that problem before. Someone else here may have more suggestions.
creator: davidsk

content:
Try this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database to answer what is in the images.

As for the actual words, you probably have an an over active firewall or antivirus product installed. But why are you trying to download it? I appear to be already installed. Reinstalling is almost guaranteed not to fix anything. It is about the last thing anyone in this forum would recommend for most issues related to getting mail or sending mail. It can work for operating system integration issues. But not for mail issues on existing accounts. The settings for which are totally unaffected by reinstalling.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: go to settings Search for spell (That is why the image shows the word spell in a yellow highlight) Then set it how you want it.
